summary.long: Psalm is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
Blessed is the man
    who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly,
nor stands in the path of sinners,
    nor sits in the seat of scoffers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but his delight is in the law of the Lord,
    and in His law he meditates day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be like a tree planted by the rivers of water,
    that brings forth its fruit in its season;
its leaf will not wither,
    and whatever he does will prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ungodly are not so,
    but are like the chaff
    which the wind drives away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the ungodly will not stand in the judgment,
    nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord knows the way of the righteous,
    but the way of the ungodly will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the nations rage,
    and the peoples plot in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth set themselves,
    and the rulers take counsel together,
against the Lord
    and against His anointed, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us tear off their bonds
    and cast away their ropes from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sits in the heavens laughs;
    the Lord ridicules them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He will speak to them in His wrath
    and terrify them in His burning anger:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have installed My king
    on Zion, My holy hill.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ask of Me,
    and I will give you the nations for your inheritance,
    and the ends of the earth for your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will break them with a scepter of iron;
    you will dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now then, you kings, be wise;
    be admonished, you judges of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with fear;
    tremble with trepidation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kiss the son, lest He become angry,
    and you perish in the way,
for His wrath kindles in a flash.
    Blessed are all who seek refuge in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, how my foes have multiplied!
    Many rise up against me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are saying about my life,
    “There is no help for him in God.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O Lord, are a shield for me,
    my glory and the One who raises up my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried to the Lord with my voice,
    and He answered me from His holy hill. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lay down and slept;
    I awoke, for the Lord sustained me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not be afraid of multitudes of people
    who have set themselves against me all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation belongs to the Lord.
    Your blessing is on Your people. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me when I call,
    O God of my righteousness!
You have given me relief when I was in distress;
    have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O people, how long will you turn my glory into shame?
    How long will you love vanity and seek after lies? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know that the Lord set apart the faithful for Himself;
    the Lord hears when I call to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble in awe, and do not sin.
    Commune with your own heart on your bed,
    and be still. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Offer sacrifices of righteousness,
    and trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are saying, “Who will show us any good?”
    Lift up the light of Your face over us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have placed gladness in my heart
    that is better than when their corn and their new wine abound.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear to my words, O Lord;
    consider my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the voice of my cry,
    my King and my God,
    for to You will I pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness,
    nor will evil dwell with You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who boast will not stand in Your sight;
    You hate all workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, in the abundance of Your mercy
    I will enter Your house;
in fear of You I will worship
    at Your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You, Lord, will bless the righteous;
    You surround him with favor like a shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, do not rebuke me in Your anger,
    nor discipline me in the heat of Your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am weak;
    O Lord, heal me, for my bones are terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is greatly troubled,
    but You, O Lord, how long?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, O Lord, rescue my soul.
    Save me for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in death there is no remembrance of You;
    in Sheol who will give You thanks?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My eye wastes away from grief;
    it grows weak because of all those hostile to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity;
    for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has heard my supplication;
    the Lord accepts my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all my enemies be ashamed and greatly terrified;
    may they turn back and be suddenly ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, in You I put my trust;
    save me from all those who persecute me, and deliver me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest they tear my soul like a lion,
    rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, if I have done this,
    if there is iniquity in the palms of my hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have repaid evil to him who was at peace with me,
    or have delivered my adversary without cause,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The congregation of the peoples surround You;
    return above it to heaven’s heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My defense depends on God,
    who saves the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is a righteous judge,
    and God has indignation every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He has prepared for Himself deadly weapons;
    He makes His arrows flaming shafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked man writhes in pain of iniquity;
    he has conceived mischief and brought forth falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who digs a hole and hollows it
    will then fall into his own pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mischief will return on his own head;
    his violence will descend on the crown of his own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will thank the Lord according to His righteousness,
    and will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, our Lord,
    how excellent is Your name in all the earth! 
You have set Your glory
    above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants
    You have ordained strength
because of Your enemies,
    to silence the enemy and the avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I consider Your heavens,
    the work of Your fingers,
the moon and the stars,
    which You have established,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
what is man that You are mindful of him,
    and the son of man that You attend to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have made him a little lower than the angels,
    and crowned him with glory and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given him dominion over the works of Your hands;
    You have put all things under his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all sheep and oxen,
    and also the beasts of the field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the birds of the air,
    and the fish of the sea,
    and whatever travels the paths of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, our Lord,
    how excellent is Your name in all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to You, O Lord, with my whole heart;
    I will declare all Your marvelous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be glad and rejoice in You;
    I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my enemies are turned back,
    they will stumble and perish at Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have maintained my right and my cause;
    You sat on the throne judging what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rebuked the nations,
    You have destroyed the wicked,
    You have wiped out their name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord remains forever;
    He has established His throne for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will judge the world in righteousness;
    He will give judgment to the peoples in uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed,
    a refuge in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who know Your name will put their trust in You,
    for You, Lord, have not forsaken those who seek You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to the Lord who dwells in Zion;
    declare His deeds among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who avenges deaths remembers them;
    He does not forget the cry of the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord; consider my trouble from those who hate me,
    O You who lifts me up from the gates of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may recount all Your praise
    in the gates of the daughter of Zion,
    that I may rejoice in Your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made;
    their own foot is caught in the net which they hid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is known by the judgment that He executes;
    the wicked one is snared in the work of his own hands. Meditation. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked will be turned to Sheol,
    and all the nations that forget God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the needy will not always be forgotten,
    nor will the hope of the poor perish forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O Lord, may mortals not prevail;
    let the nations be judged in Your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put them in fear, O Lord,
    that the nations themselves may know they are mortals. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You stand far off, O Lord?
    Why do You hide Yourself in times of trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In arrogance the wicked persecutes the poor;
    let them be caught in the devices they have planned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wicked boasts of his soul’s desire;
    he blesses the greedy and despises the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek God;
    God is not in all his thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved;
    for generations I shall not meet adversity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mouth is filled with cursing and deceit and oppression;
    under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He crouches; he lies low,
    so that the unfortunate fall by his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten;
    He hides His face; He will never see it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O Lord! O God, lift up Your hand!
    Do not forget the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do the wicked despise God?
    He says in his heart,
    “You will require an account.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen it, for You observe trouble and grief,
    to repay it with Your hand.
The unfortunate one entrusts it to You;
    You are the helper of the orphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is King forever and ever;
    the nations perished from His land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the humble You have heard, O Lord;
    You make their heart attentive; You bend Your ear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to judge the orphan and the oppressed;
    man on earth no longer trembles.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for the wicked bend their bow;
    they make ready their arrow on the string,
that they may treacherously shoot
    the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the foundations are broken,
    what can the righteous do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is in His holy temple,
    His throne is in heaven;
His eyes see,
    His eyes examine mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord tests the righteous,
    but the wicked and one who loves violence
    His soul hates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help, Lord, for the godly man comes to an end,
    for the faithful disappear from sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They speak empty words, each with his own neighbor;
    they speak with flattering lips and a double heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will cut off all flattering lips,
    and the tongue that speaks proud things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who have said, “With our tongue will we prevail;
    our lips are in our control, who is master over us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because the poor are plundered,
    because the needy sigh,
now I will arise,” says the Lord;
    “I will place him in the safety for which he yearns.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will keep them, O Lord;
    You will preserve them from this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked walk on every side,
    when the worthless of mankind are exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will You forget me for good?
    How long will you hide Your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will I harbor cares in my soul
    and sorrow in my heart by day?
    How long will my enemy loom over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take note and answer me, O Lord my God!
    Brighten my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest my enemy say, “I have him,”
    lest my foes exult when I stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I for my part confide in Your kindness;
    may my heart exult in Your salvation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord,
    because He has dealt bountifully with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool has said in his heart,
    “There is no God.”
They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds,
    there is none who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord looks down from heaven
    on the children of men,
to see if there are any who understand,
    who seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all turn aside,
    together they become corrupt;
there is none who does good,
    not even one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
    who eat my people as they eat bread,
    but do not call on the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they were in great fear,
    for God is with the generation of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shame the counsel of the poor,
    but the Lord is his refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion!
    When the Lord turns back the captivity of His people,
    Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, who will abide in Your tabernacle?
    Who will dwell in Your holy hill?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
he who does not put his money out to usury,
    nor take a bribe against the innocent. 
He who does these things
    will never be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Preserve me, O God,
    for in You I take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have said to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
    my welfare has no existence outside of You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the holy ones who are in the land,
    they are the majestic ones; in them is all my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who chase after other gods,
    their sorrows will be multiplied;
their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
    nor lift their names on my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup;
    You support my lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places;
    yes, an inheritance is beautiful for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless the Lord who has given me counsel;
    my affections also instruct me in the night seasons.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices;
    my flesh also will rest in security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You will not leave my soul in Sheol,
    nor will You suffer Your godly one to see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear a just cause, O Lord,
    attend to my cry;
give ear to my prayer
    that is not spoken from deceitful lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my sentence go out from Your presence;
    may Your eyes see rightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the works of men,
    by the word of Your lips
I have avoided
    the paths of the violent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
placing my steps in Your paths,
    that my footsteps do not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called on You, for You will answer me, O God;
    incline Your ear to me, and hear my speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show marvelously Your lovingkindness,
    O Deliverer of those who seek refuge
    by Your right hand from those who arise in opposition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me as the apple of Your eye;
    hide me under the shadow of Your wings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the wicked who bring ruin to me,
    from my deadly enemies who surround me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They close their hard hearts;
    with their mouth they speak proudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have now encircled us in our steps;
    they have set their eyes to bend down to the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it is like a lion that is anxious to rip its prey,
    and as a young lion lurking in secrecy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O Lord! Confront him, cast him down!
    Deliver my soul from the wicked by Your sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will see Your face in righteousness;
    I will be satisfied when I awake with Your likeness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I love You, O Lord, my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised,
    and I will be saved from my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of death encircled me,
    and the torrents of destruction terrified me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of Sheol surrounded me;
    the snares of death confronted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I called on the Lord,
    and cried for help to my God;
He heard my voice from His temple,
    and my cry for help came before Him to His ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He bent the heavens and came down,
    and darkness was under His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rode on a cherub, and flew;
    He flew swiftly on the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At the brightness before Him His thick clouds passed by,
    hailstones and coals of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord also thundered in the heavens,
    and the Most High gave His voice,
    hailstones and coals of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent out His arrows and scattered them,
    and He shot out lightning and distressed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the channels of waters appeared,
    and the foundations of the world were discovered
at Your rebuke, O Lord,
    at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent from above, He took me;
    He drew me out of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
    and from those who hated me,
    for they were too strong for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They confronted me in the day of my calamity,
    but the Lord was my support.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also brought me forth into a large place;
    He delivered me because He delighted in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness;
    according to the cleanness of my hands He has repaid me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord,
    and have not wickedly departed from my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all His judgments were before me,
    and I did not put away His statutes from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was also upright before Him,
    and I kept myself from my iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord has repaid me according to my righteousness,
    according to the cleanness of my hands in His view.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the merciful You will show Yourself merciful;
    with the blameless man You will show Yourself blameless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the pure You will show Yourself pure;
    and with the crooked You will show Yourself crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You will save the afflicted people,
    but will bring down prideful eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You will cause my lamp to shine;
    the Lord my God will enlighten my darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by You I can run through a troop,
    and by my God I can leap a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For who is God except the Lord?
    Or who is a rock besides our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who clothes me with strength,
    and gives my way integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes my feet like the feet of a deer,
    and causes me to stand on my high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He trains my hands for war,
    so that my arms bend a bow of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given me the shield of Your salvation,
    and Your right hand has held me up,
    and Your gentleness has made me great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have lengthened my stride under me,
    so that my feet did not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them;
    I did not return until they were destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wounded them, and they were not able to rise;
    they are fallen under my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You clothed me with strength for the battle;
    You subdued under me those who rose up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You gave me the necks of my enemies,
    and I destroyed those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried for help, but there was none to save them;
    even to the Lord, but He did not answer them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind;
    I cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At hearing a report, they obey me;
    foreigners come cringing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreigners fade away,
    and come quaking out of their prisons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord lives! And blessed be my Rock!
    May the God of my salvation be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is God who avenges me
    and subdues the people under me;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the nations,
    and sing praises to Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives great deliverance to His king,
    and shows lovingkindness to His anointed,
    to David and to his descendants for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens declare the glory of God,
    and the firmament shows His handiwork.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day unto day utters speech,
    and night unto night declares knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no speech and there are no words;
    their voice is not heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their line has gone out through all the earth,
    and their words to the end of the world. 
In them has He set a tent for the sun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber;
    it rejoices as a strong man to run a race.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its going forth is from one end of the heavens,
    and its circuit extends to the other end,
    and there is nothing hidden from its heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the fear of the Lord is clean,
    enduring forever;
the judgments of the Lord are true
    and righteous altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover by them is Your servant warned,
    and by keeping them comes great reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can understand his errors?
    Cleanse me from secret faults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep back Your servant also from presumptuous sins;
    may they not rule over me.
Then I will be upright
    and innocent from great transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in Your sight,
    O Lord, my strength and my Redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble;
    may the name of the God of Jacob defend you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
may He send you help from the sanctuary,
    and strengthen you from Zion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
may He remember all your offerings,
    and accept your burnt offering. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May He grant you according to your own heart,
    and fulfill all your counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses,
    but we will remember the name of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are brought down and fallen,
    but we arise and stand upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save, Lord!
    May the King answer us when we call.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king will rejoice in Your strength, O Lord,
    and in Your salvation how greatly will he rejoice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given him his heart’s desire,
    and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You meet him with the blessings of goodness;
    You set a crown of pure gold on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked life of You, and You gave it him,
    length of days forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His glory is great in Your salvation;
    honor and majesty You set on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You place blessings on him forever;
    You make him rejoice with gladness with Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the king trusts in the Lord,
    and by the lovingkindness of the Most High
    he will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hand will find out all Your enemies;
    Your right hand will find out those who hate You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will make them as a fiery oven
    in the time of Your appearance;
the Lord will swallow them up in His wrath,
    and fire will devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will destroy their offspring from the earth,
    and their descendants from among the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they intended evil against You;
    they devised evil thoughts they will not be able to accomplish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You will make them turn their back,
    when You aim with Your bowstrings against their face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, Lord, by Your strength;
    may we sing and make music to Your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, my God, why have You forsaken me?
    Why are You so far from delivering me,
    and from my roaring words of distress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my God, I cry in the daytime, but You do not answer;
    and at night, but I have no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You are holy,
    O You who inhabits the praises of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our fathers trusted in You;
    they trusted, and You did deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried to You and were delivered;
    they trusted in You and were not put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am a worm, and not a man;
    a reproach of men and despised by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who see me laugh me to scorn;
    they sneer with the lip, they shake the head, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I was cast on You from birth;
    You are my God from my mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Many bulls encircle me;
    strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They open their mouths against me,
    as a preying and roaring lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I can count all my bones;
    they look and stare on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They part my garments among them
    and cast lots for my clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But do not be far from me, O Lord;
    O my Help, hasten to my aid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue my soul from the sword,
    my only life from the power of the dog.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me from the lion’s mouth,
    and from the horns of the wild ox, answer me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will declare Your name to my community;
    in the midst of the congregation I will praise You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
From You my praise will be in the great congregation;
    I will pay my vows before those who fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All the ends of the world
    will remember and turn to the Lord,
and all the families of the nations
    will worship before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For kingship belongs to the Lord,
    and He rules among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Posterity will serve Him;
    it will be told to generations about the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will come and declare His righteousness
    to a people yet to be born,
    that He has acted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures;
He leads me beside still waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me
    all the days of my life,
and I will dwell in the house of the Lord
    forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth belongs to the Lord, and its fullness,
    the world, and those who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He has founded it on the seas,
    and established it on the floods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who may ascend the hill of the Lord?
    Who may stand in His holy place?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will receive the blessing from the Lord,
    and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is Jacob, the generation of those who seek Him,
    who seek Your face. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this King of glory?
    The Lord strong and mighty,
    the Lord mighty in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who is He—this King of glory?
    The Lord of Hosts,
    He is the King of glory. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To You, O Lord,
    do I lift up my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, let none who wait on You
    be ashamed;
let them be ashamed
    who transgress without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to know Your ways, O Lord;
    teach me Your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember Your mercies, O Lord, and Your lovingkindness,
    for they are from old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not remember the sins of my youth
    or my transgressions;
according to Your lovingkindness remember me,
    on account of Your goodness, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good and upright is the Lord;
    therefore He will teach sinners in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The meek will He guide in judgment,
    and the meek He will teach His way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the paths of the Lord are lovingkindness and truth,
    for those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Your name’s sake, O Lord, pardon my iniquity,
    for it is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is the man who fears the Lord?
    He will teach him in the way He should choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will dwell at ease,
    and his descendants will inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The counsel of the Lord is with those who fear him,
    and He will make His covenant known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes are ever toward the Lord,
    for He will lead my feet from the net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me, and be gracious to me,
    for I am isolated and afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The troubles of my heart are enlarged;
    bring me out of my distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on my pain and misery,
    and forgive all my sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider my enemies, for they are many,
    and they hate me with violent hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch over my life, and deliver me!
    Let me not suffer shame,
    for I seek refuge in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truth and integrity will preserve me
    while I wait for You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem Israel, O God,
    out of all their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judge me, O Lord,
    for I have walked in my integrity.
I have trusted in the Lord;
    I will not slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Examine me, O Lord, and test me;
    try my affections and my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes,
    and I have walked in Your truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not sat with the worthless,
    nor will I go with hypocrites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have hated the congregation of evildoers,
    and will not sit with the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will wash my hands in innocence;
    thus I will go around Your altar, O Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving,
    and tell of all Your wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I have loved the refuge of Your house,
    and the place where Your honor dwells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not gather my soul with sinners,
    nor my life with murderers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in whose hands is wickedness,
    and their right hand is full of bribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity;
    redeem me and be gracious to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My foot stands in an even place;
    with the congregations I will bless the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked came against me
    to eat my flesh—
my enemies and my foes—
    they stumbled and fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though an army should encamp against me,
    my heart will not fear;
though war should rise against me,
    in this will I be confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thing I have asked from the Lord,
    that will I seek after—
for me to dwell in the house of the Lord
    all the days of my life,
to see the beauty of the Lord,
    and to inquire in His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice!
    Be gracious to me and answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When You said, “Seek My face,”
    my heart said to You, “Your face, Lord, I will seek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
If my father and my mother forsake me,
    then the Lord will take me in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me Your way, O Lord,
    and lead me in an upright path,
    because of my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I believe
    I will see the goodness of the Lord
    in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the voice of my supplications
    when I cry to You,
when I lift up my hands
    toward Your most holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not draw me away with the wicked
    and with the workers of iniquity,
who speak peace to their neighbors,
    but mischief is in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because they do not regard the works of the Lord,
    nor the work of His hands,
He will destroy them
    and not build them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    because He has heard the voice of my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the strength of His people,
    and He is the saving strength of His anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give to the Lord, you heavenly beings,
    give to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give to the Lord the glory of His name;
    worship the Lord in holy splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord sounds with strength;
    the voice of the Lord—with majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;
    the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes them skip like a calf,
    Lebanon and Sirion like a wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord flashes
    like flames of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;
    the Lord shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sits enthroned above the flood,
    the Lord sits as King forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will give strength to His people;
    the Lord will bless His people with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will extol You, O Lord, for You have drawn me up,
    and have not caused my foes to rejoice over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord my God, I cried to You,
    and You healed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, You have brought up my soul from the grave;
    You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, O you saints of His,
    and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For His anger endures but a moment,
    in His favor is life;
weeping may endure for a night,
    but joy comes in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my prosperity I said,
    “I will never be moved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, by Your favor
    You had set me strong as a mountain;
You hid Your face,
    and I was terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried to You, O Lord,
    and to the Lord I made supplication:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What profit is there in my death,
    if I go down to the pit?
Will the dust give You thanks?
    Will it declare Your truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O Lord, and be gracious to me;
    Lord, be my helper.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have turned my mourning into dancing;
    You have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent.
    O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You are my rock and my fortress;
    for Your name’s sake lead me and guide me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lead me out of the net that they have hidden for me,
    for You are my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Into Your hand I commit my spirit;
    You have redeemed me, O Lord, God of truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have hated those who regard worthless vanity,
    but I trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and have not delivered me up into the hand of the enemy;
    You have set my feet in a broad place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For my life is spent with grief,
    and my years with sighing;
my strength fails because of my iniquity,
    and my bones waste away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I became a reproach among all my enemies,
    but especially among my neighbors,
and a dread to my acquaintances;
    those who saw me outside fled from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind;
    I am like a broken vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I trusted in You, O Lord;
    I said, “You are my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Make Your face to shine on Your servant;
    save me by Your lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the lying lips be put to silence,
    who speak arrogantly
    in pride and contempt against the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, how great is Your goodness,
    which You have laid up for those who fear You,
which You have done for those
    seeking refuge in You before people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will hide them in the secret of Your presence
    from conspirators;
You will keep them secretly in a shelter
    from the strife of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord,
    for He has shown me His marvelous lovingkindness
    in a fortified city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I said in my haste,
    “I am cut off from before Your eyes.”
Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications
    when I cried to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be strong, and He will strengthen your heart,
    all you who wait for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is he
    whose transgression is forgiven,
    whose sin is covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man
    against whom the Lord does not count iniquity,
    and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I kept silent,
    my bones wasted away
    through my groaning all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For day and night
    Your hand was heavy on me;
my strength was changed
    into the drought of summer. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I acknowledged my sin to You,
    and my iniquity I did not conceal.
I said, “I will confess
    my transgressions to the Lord,”
and You forgave
    the iniquity of my sin. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this cause everyone who is godly will pray to You
    in a time when You may be found;
surely in the floods of great waters
    they will not reach him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go;
    I will counsel you with my eye on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be as the horse or as the mule
    that are without understanding,
that must be restrained with bit and bridle,
    or they will not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many sorrows come to the wicked,
    but lovingkindness will surround
    the man who trusts in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, you righteous one;
    and shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous,
    for praise is fitting for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord with the harp;
    make music to Him with an instrument of ten strings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Him a new song;
    play an instrument skillfully with a joyful shout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the word of the Lord is upright,
    and all His work is done in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loves righteousness and justice;
    the earth is full of the lovingkindness of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made,
    and all their host by the breath of His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap;
    He puts the depths in storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord;
    let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He spoke, and it was done;
    He commanded, and it stood fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord frustrates the counsel of the nations;
    He restrains the purposes of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The counsel of the Lord stands forever,
    the purposes of His heart to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
    the people whom He has chosen as His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord looks from heaven;
    He sees all the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the place of His habitation He gazes
    on all the inhabitants of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He fashions their hearts alike;
    He considers all their works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No king is saved by a great army;
    a mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A horse is a vain hope for safety;
    it will not deliver by its great strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye of the Lord is on those who fear Him,
    on those who hope in His lovingkindness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deliver their soul from death,
    and to keep them alive in famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul waits for the Lord;
    He is our help and our shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our heart will rejoice in Him,
    because we have trusted in His holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Your lovingkindness, O Lord, be on us,
    just as we hope in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless the Lord at all times;
    His praise will continually be in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul will make its boast in the Lord;
    the humble will hear of it and be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, magnify the Lord with me,
    and let us exalt His name together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sought the Lord, and He answered me,
    and delivered me from all my fears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They looked to Him and became radiant,
    and their faces are not ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This poor man cried, and the Lord heard,
    and saved him out of all his troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel of the Lord camps around those who fear Him,
    and delivers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good;
    blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, fear the Lord, you His saints;
    for the ones who fear Him will not be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions are in want and suffer hunger,
    but the ones who seek the Lord will not lack any good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, you children, listen to me;
    I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is the man who desires life,
    and loves a long life in order to see good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your tongue from evil,
    and your lips from speaking deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away from evil, and do good;
    seek peace, and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and His ears are open to their cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The face of the Lord is against the ones doing evil,
    to cut off the memory of them from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears,
    and delivers them out of all their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is near to the broken-hearted,
    and saves the contrite of spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
    but the Lord delivers him out of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous one keeps all his bones;
    not one of them is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil will slay the wicked,
    and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord redeems the life of His servants,
    and all who take refuge in Him will not be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead my cause, O Lord, with my adversaries;
    fight those who fight me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take hold of the large shield and small shield,
    and rise up for my help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw the spear and javelin
    against those who pursue me.
Say to my soul,
    “I am Your salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who seek my life
    be ashamed and humiliated;
may those who plan my injury
    be turned back and put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be as chaff before the wind,
    and may the angel of the Lord cast them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their way be dark and slippery,
    and may the angel of the Lord pursue them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For without cause they have hidden their net for me in a pit,
    which they have dug without cause for my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My soul will be joyful in the Lord;
    it will rejoice in His salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my bones will say,
    “Lord, who is like You,
who delivers the poor from a stronger one,
    the poor and the needy from the one who robs them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Witnesses intent on violence rose up;
    they accused me of things I knew nothing about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rewarded me evil for good,
    the bereavement of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
with hypocritical mockers in feasts,
    they gnashed on me with their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, how long will You look on?
    Rescue my soul from their destructions,
    my life from the lions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give You thanks in the great congregation;
    I will praise You among a mighty people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my deceitful enemies
    not rejoice over me;
nor may those who hate me without cause
    wink with their eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they do not speak peace,
    but they devise deceitful matters
    against the restful ones in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They opened their mouth wide against me,
    and said, “Aha, aha, our eye has seen it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This You have seen, O Lord; do not be silent;
    O Lord, be not far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rouse Yourself and awake for my judgment,
    for my cause, my God and my Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judge me, O Lord my God, according to Your righteousness,
    and may they not rejoice over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they not say in their hearts, “Ah, we have our soul’s desire.”
    May they not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who rejoice at my harm be ashamed
    and altogether put to shame;
may they be clothed with shame and dishonor
    who magnify themselves against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who favor my righteous cause
    shout for joy and be glad;
may they say continually, “The Lord be magnified,
    who delights in the peace of His servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue will speak of Your righteousness
    and of Your praise all the day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An oracle within my heart
    about the transgression of the wicked:
There is no fear of God
    before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they flatter themselves in their own eyes,
    that their iniquity cannot be found out and hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of their mouth are wickedness and deceit;
    they have ceased to be wise and to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens,
    and Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How excellent is Your lovingkindness, O God!
Therefore mankind
    seeks refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will drink their fill from the abundance of Your house,
    and You will cause them to drink from the river of Your pleasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For with You is the fountain of life;
    in Your light we see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You,
    and Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the foot of the arrogant come against me,
    and do not let the hand of the wicked cause me to wander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the workers of iniquity have fallen;
    they are cast down and not able to rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fret because of evildoers,
    nor be jealous of those who do injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they will quickly wither like the grass,
    and fade like the green herbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord, and do good;
    dwell in the land, and practice faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Delight yourself in the Lord,
    and He will give you the desires of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your way to the Lord;
    trust also in Him, and He will bring it to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will bring forth your righteousness as the light,
    and your judgment as the noonday.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let go of anger, and forsake wrath;
    do not fret—it surely leads to evil deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For evildoers will be cut off,
    but those who hope in the Lord will inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For yet a little while, and the wicked will not be;
    you will look diligently for their place, and it will not be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the meek will inherit the earth,
    and will delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked plot against the righteous,
    and grind their teeth against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will laugh at him,
    for He sees that his day is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have drawn out the sword
    and have bent their bow,
to cast down the poor and needy,
    and to slay those on the upright path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their sword will enter into their own heart,
    and their bows will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little that the righteous has
    than the abundance of many wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the arms of the wicked will be broken,
    but the Lord supports the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows the days of people of integrity,
    and their inheritance will be forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will not be ashamed in the evil time,
    and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked borrows and does not repay,
    but the righteous is gracious and gives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who are blessed of Him will inherit the earth,
    but those who are cursed of Him will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The steps of a man are made firm by the Lord;
    He delights in his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he falls, he will not be hurled down,
    for the Lord supports him with His hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous are gracious and lend,
    and their offspring are a source of blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from evil and do good,
    and abide forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord loves justice,
    and does not forsake His saints;
they are preserved forever,
    but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will inherit the land,
    and dwell on it forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
    and their tongue speaks justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of their God is in their heart;
    none of their steps will slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked watch the righteous,
    and seek to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not forsake them to their hand,
    nor condemn them when they are judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope in the Lord,
    and keep His way,
and He will exalt you to inherit the land;
    when the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen the wicked in great power,
    and spreading himself like a luxuriant tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he passed away, and he was not;
    I sought him, but he could not be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mark the blameless man, and consider the upright,
    for the end of that man is peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the transgressors will be destroyed together;
    the end of the wicked is to be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;
    He is their refuge in the time of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, do not rebuke me in Your wrath,
    nor chasten me in Your hot displeasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Your arrows pierce me,
    and Your hand presses down on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation,
    nor is there health in my bones because of my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my iniquities have passed over my head;
    as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My wounds grow foul and fester
    because of my foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am bent, I am bowed down greatly;
    I go mourning all the day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my sides are filled with burning,
    and there is no soundness in my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am numb and completely crushed;
    I have roared because of the groaning of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, all my desire is before You,
    and my sighing is not hidden from You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart throbs, my strength fails me;
    as for the light of my eyes, it also is gone from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friends and my companions stand back because of my affliction,
    and those close to me stand at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I, like a deaf man, did not hear;
    and like a dumb man, did not open my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus I was as a man who does not hear,
    and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in You, O Lord, do I hope;
    You will answer, O Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I said, “Lest otherwise they should rejoice over me.
    When my foot slips, they magnify themselves against me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am ready to stumble,
    and my pain is continually before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will declare my iniquity;
    I am anxious because of my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my enemies are lively, and they are strong;
    and those who wrongfully hate me are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those also who repay evil for good are my adversaries,
    because I pursue good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not abandon me, O Lord;
    O my God, do not be far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make haste to help me,
    O Lord, my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “I will take heed of my ways
    so that I do not sin with my tongue;
I will keep my mouth muzzled
    while the wicked are before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Lord, make me to know my end,
    and what is the measure of my days,
    that I may know how transient I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now, Lord, what do I wait for?
    My hope is in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from all my transgressions;
    do not make me the reproach of the foolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was speechless, I did not open my mouth,
    because You did it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove Your blow from me;
    I am consumed by the hostility of Your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Turn Your gaze of displeasure from me, that I may smile,
    before I go away and am no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I waited patiently for the Lord,
    and He turned to me, and heard my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also brought me up out of a horrible pit,
    out of the miry clay,
and set my feet on a rock,
    and established my steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has put a new song in my mouth,
    even praise to our God;
many will see it, and fear,
    and will trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man
    who places trust in the Lord,
but does not turn toward the proud,
    nor those falling away to falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice and offering You did not desire;
    You have opened up my ears to listen.
Burnt offering and sin offering
    You have not required.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Behold, I have come;
    in the scroll of the book it is written of me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I delight to do Your will, O my God;
    Your law is within my inward parts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold Your compassion from me, O Lord;
    may Your lovingkindness and Your truth always guard me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me;
    O Lord, make haste to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those seeking to snatch away my life
    be ashamed and confounded together;
may those who desire my harm
    be driven backward and dishonored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who say to me “Aha, aha!”
    be appalled on account of their shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all those who seek You
    rejoice and be glad in You;
may those who love Your salvation say continually,
    “The Lord is magnified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who consider the poor;
    the Lord will deliver them in the day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will preserve them and keep them alive,
    and they will be blessed on the earth,
    and You will not deliver them to the will of their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will sustain them on the sickbed;
    You will restore all his lying down in his illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “Lord, be gracious to me;
    heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies speak evil of me:
    “When will he die, and his name perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All who hate me whisper together against me;
    they devise harm against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“An evil disease clings to him.
    And now that he lies down, he will not rise up again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, my own close friend,
    in whom I trusted, who ate of my bread,
    has lifted up the heel against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O Lord, be gracious to me,
    and raise me up, that I may repay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By this I know that You favor me,
    because my enemy does not triumph over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, You uphold me in my integrity,
    and set me before You forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel
    from everlasting and to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the deer pants after the water brooks,
    so my soul pants after You, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
    When will I come and appear before God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tears have been my food
    day and night,
while they always say to me,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I remember these things,
    I pour out my soul within me.
For I would travel with the throng of people;
    I proceeded with them to the house of God,
with the voice of joy and thanks,
    with a multitude making a pilgrimage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you cast down, O my soul?
    And why are you disquieted in me?
Hope in God,
    for I will yet thank Him
    for the help of His presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deep calls to deep
    at the noise of Your waterfalls;
all Your waves and Your billows
    passed over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet the Lord will command His lovingkindness in the daytime,
    and in the night His song will be with me,
    a prayer to the God of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to God, my rock,
    “Why have You forgotten me?
Why do I go mourning
    because of the oppression of the enemy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With shattering in my bones,
    those harassing me reproach me,
when they say to me every day,
    “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, my soul, are you cast down?
    Why do you groan within me?
Wait for God;
    I will yet thank Him,
    For He is my deliverance and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You are the God of my refuge;
    why have You rejected me?
Why do I walk about mourning
    because of the oppression of the enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
    to the God of my joyful gladness;
with the harp I will give thanks to You,
    O God, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard with our ears, O God,
    our fathers have told us
what work You did in their days,
    in the days of old:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
how You drove out the nations with Your hand,
    and planted others instead;
how You afflicted peoples,
    and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they did not take possession of the land by their own sword,
    nor did their own arm save them;
but it was Your right hand, and Your arm,
    and the light of Your countenance, because You had favor on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my King, O God;
    command deliverances for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through You we will push down our opponents;
    through Your name we will trample those who rise up against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will not trust in my bow,
    nor will my sword save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You have saved us from our opponents,
    and have put to shame those who hate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God we boast all the day long,
    and give thanks to Your name forever. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You have rejected us and put us to shame,
    and do not go out with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make us to turn back from the opponent,
    and those who hate us make us their spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have placed us like sheep for prey,
    and have scattered us among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sell Your people for nothing,
    and do not increase Your wealth by their sale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make us a reproach to our neighbors,
    a scorn and a derision to those who surround us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make us a byword among the nations,
    a shaking of the head among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my reproach is before me,
    and the shame of my face covers me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the voice of him who reproaches and reviles,
    by reason of the enemy and avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All this is come on us,
    yet we have not forgotten You,
    nor have we dealt falsely in Your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our heart is not turned back,
    nor have our steps deviated from Your way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though You have crushed us in the place of jackals,
    and covered us with the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we have forgotten the name of our God,
    or stretched out our hands to a strange god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would not God search this out?
    For He knows the secrets of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, for Your sake we are killed all the day long;
    we are considered like sheep for the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake; why do You sleep, O Lord?
    Arise; do not reject us forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You hide Your face,
    and forget our affliction and our oppression?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our soul is bowed down to the dust;
    our body cleaves to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, be our help,
    and redeem us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
    with your splendor and your majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies;
    peoples will fall under you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever;
    the scepter of Your kingdom is an upright scepter.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All your garments are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia;
    from the ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women;
    at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, O daughter, consider and incline your ear;
    forget your own people, and your father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the king will desire your beauty.
    Since he is your lord, bow to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The daughter of Tyre will be there with a gift;
    even the rich among the people will entreat your favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The royal daughter is all glorious within her chamber;
    her clothing is plaited gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought;
    they shall enter into the king’s palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sons shall succeed your fathers;
    you will make them princes in all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
    therefore the people will praise you forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    a well-proven help in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be removed,
    and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though its waters roar and foam,
    though the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
    the holy dwelling place of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in the midst of her; she will not be moved;
    God will help her in the early dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations roared; the kingdoms were moved;
    He uttered His voice; the earth melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of Hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, see the works of the Lord,
    who makes desolations in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of Hosts is with us;
    the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clap your hands, all you people!
    Shout to God with a joyful voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord Most High is awesome;
    He is a great King over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdued peoples under us,
    and nations under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose our inheritance for us,
    the excellency of Jacob whom He loved. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God went up with a shout,
    the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
    sing praises to our King, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is the King of all the earth;
    sing praises with understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God reigns over the nations;
    God sits on His holy throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of peoples are gathered together,
    even the people of the God of Abraham.
For the shields of the earth belong to God;
    He is greatly exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised
    in the city of our God, in His holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beautiful in elevation,
    the joy of the whole earth,
is Mount Zion, on the sides of the north,
    the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is known in her citadels
    as a refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the kings were assembled,
    they passed by together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They saw it, and so they were astounded;
    they were alarmed, they hurried away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trembling seized them there,
    and pain like a woman in labor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You break the ships of Tarshish
    with an east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As we have heard,
    so have we seen
in the city of the Lord of Hosts,
    in the city of our God;
    God will establish it forever. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have thought of Your lovingkindness, O God,
    in the midst of Your temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May Mount Zion rejoice,
    may the daughters of Judah be glad,
    because of Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
    count her towers;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this God is our God forever and ever;
    He will be our guide even to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all you people;
    give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
both low and high,
    rich and poor together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak wisdom,
    and the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will incline my ear to a parable;
    I will expound my riddle with a harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I fear in the days of evil,
    when the iniquity of my stalkers surrounds me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in their wealth,
    and boast in the multitude of their riches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
none of them can by any means redeem the other,
    nor give to God a ransom for anyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
