for the redemption of their souls is costly;
    even so people cease to exist forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
making efforts to live eternally,
    and not see the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For one sees that wise men die,
    together the fool and the brute perish,
    and leave their wealth to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their graves become their perpetual homes,
    and their dwelling places to all generations,
    though they call their lands after their own names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But a man does not abide in honor;
    mankind is like the beasts that come to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is their way, it is their folly;
    yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But God shall redeem my soul from the power of Sheol,
    for He shall receive me. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fear when one is made rich,
    when the glory of his house is increased,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he takes nothing away in death;
    his glory does not descend after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though while he lives he blesses his soul—
    and men will praise you when you do well for yourself—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that soul will go to the generation of his fathers;
    they will never see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man in honor, and yet without understanding,
    is like the animals that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
    God has shined.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He calls to the heavens above,
    and to the earth, that He may judge His people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather My faithful ones together to Me,
    those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens will declare His righteousness,
    for God Himself is judge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will not reprove you for your sacrifices
    or for your burnt offerings that are continually before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take no young bull out of your house,
    nor male goats out of your folds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For every wild animal of the forest is Mine,
    and the cattle on a thousand hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know every bird of the mountains,
    and the creatures that move in the field are Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I were hungry, I would not tell you;
    for the world is Mine, and all its fullness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will I eat the flesh of bulls,
    or drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
    and pay your vows to the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and call on Me in the day of trouble;
    I will deliver you, and you will glorify Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to the wicked God says:
“What right have you to declare My statutes,
    or take My covenant in your mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hate instruction,
    and cast My words behind you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you see a thief, you are pleased,
    and have a share in those who commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You let loose your mouth to evil,
    and your tongue is bound to deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sit and speak against your brother;
    you accuse your own mother’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Now consider this, you who forget God,
    lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O God,
    according to Your lovingkindness;
according to the abundance of Your compassion,
    blot out my transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
    and cleanse me from my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I acknowledge my transgressions,
    and my sin is ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against You, You only, have I sinned,
    and done this evil in Your sight,
so that You are justified when You speak,
    and You are blameless when You judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was brought forth in iniquity,
    and in sin my mother conceived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You desire truth in the inward parts,
    and in the hidden part You make me to know wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
    wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to hear joy and gladness,
    that the bones that You have broken may rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide Your face from my sins,
    and blot out all my iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God,
    and renew a right spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me away from Your presence,
    and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore to me the joy of Your salvation,
    and uphold me with Your willing spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will teach transgressors Your ways,
    and sinners will return to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from blood guiltiness, O God,
    God of my salvation,
    and my tongue will sing aloud of Your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, open my lips,
    and my mouth will declare Your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You do not desire sacrifice, or I would give it;
    You do not delight in burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do good to Zion in Your good pleasure;
    build the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast in evil, O mighty man?
    The goodness of God endures continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your tongue devises calamities,
    like a sharp razor, you worker of treachery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love evil more than good,
    and lying rather than speaking righteousness. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love all devouring words,
    O you deceitful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous also will see and fear,
    and will laugh in contempt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“See, this is the man
    who did not make God his refuge,
but trusted in the abundance of riches,
    and grew strong in his own wickedness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like a green olive tree
    in the house of God;
I trust in the mercy of God
    forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The fool has said in his heart,
    “There is no God.”
They are corrupt, and have done abhorrent injustice;
    there is none who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God looked down from heaven
    on the children of men,
to see if there were any who have insight,
    who seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
    who eat up my people as they eat bread,
    and do not call on God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they were in fear,
    where there was nothing to fear,
for God has scattered the bones of him who camps against you;
    you have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!
    When God brings back the captivity of His people,
    Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, save me by Your name,
    and judge me by Your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, hear my prayer;
    give ear to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God is my helper;
    the Lord is with those who support my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will repay my enemies for their evil.
    In Your faithfulness, destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sacrifice a freewill offering to You;
    I will give thanks to Your name, O Lord, for it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He has delivered me out of all trouble;
    and my eye has looked down on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear to my prayer, O God,
    and do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attend to me, and answer me;
I am restless in my complaint, and I murmur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the voice of the enemy,
    because of the pressure of the wicked,
for they cause trouble to drop on me,
    and in wrath they have animosity against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is in pain within me,
    and the terrors of death have fallen on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and trembling come into me,
    and horror has overwhelmed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove!
    For then I would fly away and be at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, then I would wander far off,
    and remain in the wilderness. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would hasten my escape
    from the windy storm and tempest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confuse, O Lord, divide their tongues,
    for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day and night they go around it on its walls;
    trouble and sorrow are in its midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destruction is in its midst;
    oppression and treachery do not depart from its streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But it was you, my peer,
    my guide, and my acquaintance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We took pleasant counsel together,
    and walked to the house of God in company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May death surprise them,
    and may their lives go down to Sheol,
    for wickedness is in their dwellings and among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will call on God,
    and the Lord will save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evening and morning and at noon,
    I will make my complaint and murmur,
    and He will hear my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God will hear and afflict them,
    even He who sits enthroned from of old. Selah
Because they do not change,
    therefore they do not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friend has set his hands against those at peace with him;
    he has violated his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of his mouth were smoother than butter,
    but battle was in his heart;
his words were softer than oil,
    yet they were drawn swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast your burden on the Lord,
    and He will sustain you;
He will never allow
    the righteous to be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O God, will cast the wicked down
    into the pit of destruction;
men of blood and deceitful men
    will not live out half their days. 
But I will trust in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, for man would crush me;
    all day long he who battles oppresses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my enemies would crush me,
    for there are many who arrogantly battle against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day when I am afraid,
    I will trust in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God whose word I praise,
    in God I have trusted; I will not fear.
    What can mere flesh do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day they twist my words;
    all their thoughts are against me for evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They stir up strife, they lurk,
    they watch my steps,
    when they wait for my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should there be deliverance for them on account of wickedness?
    In Your anger cast down the peoples, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In God whose word I praise,
    in the Lord whose word I praise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in God I trust, I will not fear;
    what can a man do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your vows are on me, O God;
    I will complete them with thank offerings to You;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for You have delivered my soul from death,
    even my feet from stumbling,
to walk before God
    in the light of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me!
    For my soul seeks refuge in You;
in the shadow of Your wings I will make my refuge,
    until the ruinous storm passes by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cry to God Most High,
    to God who vindicates me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will send from heaven and save me
    from the taunt of the one who crushes me. Selah
    God will send forth His mercy and His truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is among lions,
    and I lie among the sons of men who blaze like fire,
whose teeth are spears and arrows,
    and their tongue a sharp sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
    may Your glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, my glory!
    Awake, psaltery and harp!
    I will awake the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will thank You, O Lord, among the peoples;
    I will sing to You among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Your mercy is great up to the heavens,
    and Your truth extends to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
    may Your glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you truly speak righteousness, O heavenly gods?
    Do you judge uprightly, O earthly men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, in the heart you work wickedness;
    you weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are estranged from the womb onward;
    those who speak lies go astray from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their poison is like the poison of a serpent;
    they are like the deaf adder that plugs its ear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and will not listen to the voice of charmers,
    even the best and wisest enchanter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Break their teeth in their mouth, O God;
    break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they melt away as waters which run continually;
    when he bends his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be trodden under.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they become as a snail that melts as it goes,
    like the untimely birth of a woman, may they not see the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before your pots can feel the thorns’ heat, green or burning,
    may He sweep them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance;
    he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God;
    give me refuge from those who rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,
    and save me from bloodthirsty people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For no guilt of mine, they run and prepare themselves.
    Arise to help me, and take notice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening,
    they growl like a dog,
    and go around the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O Lord, will laugh at them;
    You will have all the nations in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my strength, I will wait on You;
    for God is my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The God of lovingkindness will go before me;
    God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not slay them,
    lest my people forget;
scatter them by Your power,
    and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sin of their mouth
    and the words of their lips,
    may they be snared by their pride,
and because of curses and lies that they speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consume them in wrath,
    consume them so they no longer exist;
and let them know that God rules in Jacob
    to the ends of the earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At evening they return,
    and growl like a dog,
    and go around the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They roam about to eat,
    and if they are not satisfied, they complain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will sing of Your power;
    I will sing aloud of Your lovingkindness in the morning,
for You have been my refuge
    and escape in the day of my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To You, O my strength, I will sing,
    for God is my refuge, and the God of my lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, You have rejected us, You have scattered us;
    You have been displeased; take us back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made the earth tremble; You have split it open;
    heal its breaches, for it shook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have shown Your people hard times;
    You have made us drink wine, causing us to stagger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given a banner to those who fear You,
    that they may flee to it from the bow. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That Your beloved ones may be delivered,
    save with Your right hand and answer us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken in His holiness:
    “I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem,
    and measure out the Valley of Sukkoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
    Who will lead me into Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, O God, have You not cast us off?
    And You, O God, did not go out with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help from trouble,
    for the help of man is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through God we will do valiantly,
    for He will tread down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry, O God,
    attend to my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You have been a refuge for me,
    and a strong tower from the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will abide in Your tent forever;
    I will seek refuge in the covering of Your wings. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You, O God, have heard my vows;
    You have given me the heritage of those who fear Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May You prolong the king’s life,
    and may his years be as many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he sit enthroned before God forever;
    oh, prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus will I sing praise to Your name forever,
    that I may fulfill my vows day by day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul waits in silence on God alone;
    from Him comes my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He only is my rock and my salvation;
    He is my refuge; I will not be greatly shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you attack a man,
    to batter him, all of you,
    as you would a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They only conspire to cast him down
    from his high position;
    they delight in lies,
they bless with their mouth,
    but they curse inwardly. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul, wait silently for God,
    for my hope is from Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He only is my rock and my salvation;
    He is my refuge; I will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God is my salvation and my glory;
    the rock of my strength, and my shelter, is in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken once,
    twice have I heard this:
that power belongs to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen You in the sanctuary,
    to see Your power and Your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because Your lovingkindness is better than life,
    my lips will praise You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus will I bless You while I live;
    I will lift up my hands in Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul will be satisfied as with marrow and fatness,
    and my mouth will praise You with joyful lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I remember You on my bed,
    and meditate on You in the night watches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because You have been my help,
    therefore in the shadow of Your wings I will rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings hard to You;
    Your right hand upholds me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who seek my soul to destroy it
    will go into the lower parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fall by the sword;
    they will be a portion for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint;
    guard my life from dread of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked,
    from the throng of the workers of iniquity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they sharpen their tongue like a sword,
    and bend their bows to shoot their arrows—bitter words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they may shoot in secret at the blameless;
    suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They devise injustice,
    saying “We have perfected a secret plot.”
    Both the inward thought of man and the heart are deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will suddenly shoot them with an arrow;
    they will be wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will be glad in the Lord,
    and seek refuge in Him,
    and all the upright in heart will glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise awaits You, O God, in Zion;
    and to You a vow will be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O You who hears prayer,
    to You all flesh will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iniquities are stronger than me;
    as for our transgressions, You atone for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man You choose and allow to draw near;
    he will dwell in Your courts.
We will be satisfied with the goodness of Your house,
    even of Your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In righteousness You will answer us gloriously,
    O God of our salvation,
You, who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth,
    and of those who are afar off on the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who established the mountains by His strength,
    being clothed with might;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who stills the noise of the seas,
    the noise of their waves,
    and the tumult of peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You crown the year with Your goodness,
    and Your paths drip abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They drip on the pastures of the wilderness,
    and the hills clothe themselves with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Shout joyfully to God, all you lands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing out the glory of His name;
    make His praise glorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to God, “How awesome are Your works!
    Through the greatness of Your power
    Your enemies cringe before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see the works of God;
    He is awesome in His doings toward mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, bless our God, you people,
    and make the voice of His praise to be heard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who keeps our soul among the living,
    and does not allow our feet to slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You, O God, have proved us;
    You have refined us, as silver is refined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought us into the net;
    You placed distress on our backs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will go into Your house with burnt offerings;
    I will fulfill my vows to You,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which my lips have uttered,
    and my mouth spoke when I was in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come and hear, all you who fear God,
    and I will declare what He has done for my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried to Him with my mouth,
    and He was extolled with my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I regard iniquity in my heart,
    the Lord will not hear me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but certainly God has heard me;
    He has attended to the voice of my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be God,
    who has not turned away my prayer,
    nor His mercy from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God be gracious to us, and bless us,
    and cause His face to shine on us; Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that Your way may be known on earth,
    Your salvation among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise You, O God;
    let all the peoples praise You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise You, O God;
    let all the peoples praise You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will the earth yield its produce,
    and God, our God, will bless us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will bless us,
    and all the ends of the earth will fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered;
    let those who hate Him flee before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As smoke is driven away,
    You drive them away;
as wax melts before the fire,
    so may the wicked perish before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A father of the fatherless, and a protector of the widows,
    is God in His holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, when You went forth before Your people,
    when You marched through the wasteland, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth shook;
    the heavens also poured down rain
at the presence of God; even Sinai shook
    at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, O God, sent plentiful rain;
    You established Your inheritance when it was weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your congregation has lived in it;
    You, O God, by Your goodness have prepared for the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gave the word;
    great was the company of women who proclaimed it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Kings of armies flee; they flee!”
    Even the women who were at home divided the spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you sleep between the sheepfolds,
    yet you will be like the wings of a dove overlaid with silver,
    and its feathers with yellow gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered kings in it,
    it was white as snow on Mount Zalmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountain of God is as the mountain of Bashan;
    a mountain of many peaks like the mountain of Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The chariots of God are twice ten thousand, even thousands of thousands;
    the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have ascended on high,
    You have led captivity captive;
    You have received gifts from people,
yes, even from the rebellious,
    that the Lord God might dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loads us with benefits,
    even the God who is our salvation. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That God is for us, the God of saving acts;
    and to God the Lord belongs escape from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shatter the head of His enemies,
    and the scalp of one who walks in his trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said, “I will cause them to return from Bashan,
    I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that your foot may stomp in the blood of your enemies,
    and the tongue of your dogs may have a portion in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have seen Your processions, O God,
    the processions of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Bless God in the congregations,
    the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is little Benjamin leading them,
    the princes of Judah and their throng of people,
    the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your God has commanded your strength;
    strengthen, O God, what You have done for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Your temple above Jerusalem,
    kings will bring gifts to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke the animals that live among the reeds,
    the herd of bulls, with the calves of the people,
until everyone submits himself with pieces of silver;
    scatter peoples who delight in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ambassadors will come out of Egypt;
    Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth;
    oh, sing praises to the Lord; Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to Him who rides on the heavens, the ancient heavens;
    He who sends out His voice, a mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God!
    For the waters have come up to my throat.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate me without cause
    are more than the hairs of my head;
they are mighty
    who would destroy me, being my wrongful enemies,
so that I must pay back
    what I did not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, You know my folly,
    and my sins are not hidden from You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who wait on You,
    O Lord God of Hosts,
    not be ashamed because of me;
may those who seek You
    not be humiliated because of me,
    O God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because for Your sake I have endured insult;
    humiliation has covered my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become estranged to my relatives,
    and a foreigner to my mother’s children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the zeal of Your house has consumed me,
    and the insults of those who insulted You fell on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I wept with fasting for my soul,
    it became an insult to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also made sackcloth my garment,
    and I became a byword to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sit in the gate speak against me,
    and I am the song of the drunkards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my prayer is to You, O Lord;
    in an acceptable time, O God,
in the abundance of Your mercy,
    answer me in the truth of Your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me out of the mire
    that I may not sink;
may I be delivered from those who hate me,
    and out of the watery depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, O Lord, for Your lovingkindness is good;
    turn Your face to me according to the abundance of Your tender mercies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide Your face from Your servant,
    for I am in trouble; answer me quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw near to my soul, and redeem it;
    deliver me because of my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have known how I am insulted, and my shame and my dishonor;
    my adversaries are all before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They also gave me poison for my food,
    and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their table become a snare before them,
    and may security become a trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their eyes be darkened so they do not see,
    and make their sides shake continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out Your indignation on them,
    and may Your wrathful anger overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their habitation be desolate,
    and may no one dwell in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they persecute him whom You have struck down,
    and they recount the pain of those You have wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add punishment to their iniquity,
    and do not let them come into Your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
    and not be written along with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am poor and in pain;
    may Your salvation, O God, set me secure on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
    and will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also will please the Lord
    more than an ox or bull with horns and hoofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The humble will see this and be glad;
    and you who seek God, may your heart live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord hears the poor,
    and does not despise His prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let heaven and earth praise Him,
    the seas and everything that moves in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of His servants will inherit it;
    and those who love His name will dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make haste, O God, to deliver me!
    Make haste to help me, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who seek my life
    be ashamed and confused;
may those who desire my harm
    be driven back and humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they turn back as a consequence of their shame
    who say “Aha! Aha!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May all those who seek You
    rejoice and be glad in You;
and may those who love Your salvation continually say,
    “God be magnified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In You, O Lord, I seek refuge;
    may I never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me in Your righteousness and help me escape;
    incline Your ear to me and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,
    out of the hand of the unjust and cruel man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You are my hope, O Lord God;
    You are my confidence from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am like a wondrous sign to many;
    You are my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will be filled with Your praise
    and with Your glory all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me off in the time of old age;
    do not forsake me when my strength fails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my enemies speak against me;
    and those who watch for my life take counsel together,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, do not be far from me;
    O my God, act quickly to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I will hope continually,
    and will add to all Your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will declare Your righteousness
    and Your salvation all the day,
    for I cannot know their numbers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go in the strength of the Lord God;
    I will make mention of Your righteousness, of Yours only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, You have taught me from my youth;
    and until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now also when I am old and gray,
    O God, do not forsake me,
until I have proclaimed Your strength to this generation,
    and Your power to everyone who is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You who have shown me great distresses and troubles
    will revive me again,
and will bring me up again
    from the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will increase my greatness,
    and You will encircle and comfort me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give You thanks with the harp,
    even Your truth, O my God;
to You I will sing with the lyre,
    O Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips will rejoice
    when I sing to You,
    and my soul, which You have redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give the king Your judgments, O God,
    and Your righteousness to the king’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he judge Your people with righteousness,
    and Your poor with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the mountains bring well-being to the people,
    and the hills, in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he judge the poor of the people,
    may he save the children of the needy,
    and crush the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they fear You as long as the sun endures,
    and the moon, throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he descend like rain on the mown grass,
    as showers dripping on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days may the righteous flourish,
    and abundance of peace until the moon is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he have dominion from sea to sea,
    and from the River to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who dwell in the wilderness bow before him,
    and his enemies lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May all kings bow down before him;
    may all nations serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, may he deliver the needy when he cries;
    the poor also, and him who has no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he have compassion on the poor and needy,
    and save the lives of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he redeem their life from deceit and violence;
    and may their blood be precious in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel,
    who alone does wondrous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly God is good to Israel,
    to the pure in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet almost stumbled;
    my steps had almost slipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I was envious at the boastful;
    I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there are no pains in their death;
    their bodies are fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are not in trouble as other people;
    nor are they plagued like others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
    violence covers them as a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their eyes bulge with fatness;
    they have more than a heart could wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mock and speak with evil oppression;
    they speak loftily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
    and their tongue struts through the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore people turn to them,
    and abundant waters are drunk by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “How does God know?
    And is there knowledge with the Most High?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Observe, these are the wicked, always at ease;
    they increase in riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I have kept my heart pure for nothing,
    and washed my hands in innocence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the day long I am plagued,
    and chastened every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I said, “I will speak thus,”
    I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I thought to understand this,
    it was troublesome in my eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I went into the sanctuary of God;
    then I understood their end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely You have set them in slippery places;
    You have brought them down to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How they come to desolation, as in a moment!
    They have come to an end, utterly consumed with terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a dream when one awakes,
    so, O Lord, when You awake,
    You will despise their form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus my heart was embittered,
    and I was pierced in my feelings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was a brute and did not understand;
    I was as a beast before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless I am continually with You;
    You have held me by my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will guide me with Your counsel,
    and afterward receive me to glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom have I in heaven but You?
    And there is nothing on earth that I desire besides You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and my heart fails,
    but God is the strength of my heart
    and my portion forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who are far from You will perish;
    You destroy everyone who is unfaithful to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, why have You cast us off forever?
    Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old,
    the rod of Your inheritance, which You have redeemed,
    this Mount Zion, where You have lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Move Your footsteps to the perpetual desolations,
    to all the harm the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your enemies roar in the midst of Your meeting place;
    they set up their miracles for signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They seem like men who lift up axes
    on a thicket of trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now they strike down its carved work altogether
    with axes and hammers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have cast fire into Your sanctuary;
    they have defiled the dwelling place of Your name to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said in their hearts, “Let us destroy them together.”
    They have burned up all the meeting places of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, how long will the adversary scorn?
    Will the enemy blaspheme Your name forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You withdraw Your hand, Your right hand?
    Draw it out of Your bosom and destroy them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is my King of old,
    working salvation in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You divided the sea by Your strength;
    You broke the heads of the dragons on the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan in pieces,
    and gave him for food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You split the fountain and the flood;
    You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The day is Yours, the night also is Yours;
    You have prepared the light and the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have established all the borders of the earth;
    You have made summer and winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this, that the enemy has scorned, O Lord,
    and that the foolish people have blasphemed Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not give the life of Your turtledove to a wild animal;
    do not forget the life of Your poor forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have regard for the covenant;
    for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the oppressed not return ashamed;
    may the poor and needy praise Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O God, plead Your own cause;
    remember how the fool insults You daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forget the voice of Your enemies,
    the tumult of those who rise up against You continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When I select an appointed time,
    I will judge with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the earth and all its inhabitants are swaying,
    I steady its pillars. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said to the boastful, “Do not boast,”
    and to the wicked, “Do not lift up your horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lift up your horn on high,
    or speak with an arrogant neck.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For neither from the east nor west,
    nor from the wilderness comes victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God is the judge;
    He brings one low, and lifts up another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup,
    and it is full of mixed, foaming wine,
and He pours from it;
    surely all the wicked of the earth will find and drink its dregs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will declare forever,
    I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the horns of the wicked I will cut off,
    but the horns of the righteous will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Judah God is known;
    in Israel His name is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Salem is His abode,
    and His dwelling place in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow,
    the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are more glorious and excellent
    than the mountains of prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
    both the chariot and horse lay stunned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, even You, are to be feared;
    and who may stand in Your sight from the moment of Your anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the heavens You gave their judgment,
    and the earth feared and was silent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when God arose to judgment,
    to save all the meek of the earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the wrath of people shall bring You praise;
    the remainder of wrath You shall put on.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He reduces the spirit of princes,
    and is feared among the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried out to God with my voice,
    even to God with my voice; and He listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I remember God, and I groan;
    I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hold my eyelids open;
    I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have considered the days of old,
    the years long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Will the Lord cast off forever,
    and will He be favorable no more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has His mercy ceased forever,
    and have His promises failed for all time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has God forgotten to be gracious,
    and has He in anger shut up His tender mercies?” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “This is my grief;
    yet I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remember the works of the Lord;
    surely I will remember Your wonders of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate also on all Your work
    and ponder on Your mighty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your way, O God, is holiness;
    what god is as great as our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the God who can do wonders;
    You have declared Your strength among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have with Your arm redeemed Your people,
    the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your way is through the sea,
    and Your path in the great waters,
    and your footsteps are not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You led Your people like a flock
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O my people, to my teaching;
    incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
    I will utter insightful sayings of old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which we have heard and known,
    what our fathers have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their children,
    but will tell the coming generation
the praises of the Lord,
    and His strength, and the wonderful works that He has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He established a rule in Jacob,
    and appointed a law in Israel,
which He commanded our fathers
    that they should make them known to their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that the generation to come might know them,
    even the children who are not yet born,
    who will arise and declare them to their children:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they might set their hope in God
    and not forget the works of God,
    but keep His commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they might not be as their fathers,
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation that did not set their heart steadfast,
    and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people of Ephraim, being armed with bows,
    turned back in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not keep the covenant of God
    and refused to walk in His law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they forgot His works
    and the wonders that He had shown them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the sight of their ancestors He did marvelous wonders
    in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He divided the sea and caused them to pass through,
    and He made the waters to stand as a heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the daytime He led them with a cloud,
    and all the night with a light of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split rocks in the wilderness
    and gave them abundance to drink as out of the great depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought streams out of the rock
    and caused waters to run down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sinned yet more against Him
    by provoking the Most High in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They tested God in their heart
    by demanding the food that they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spoke against God by saying,
    “Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He struck the rock, so that the waters gushed out
    and the streams overflowed.
Can He give bread
    or provide meat for His people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
because they did not believe in God
    nor trust in His deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet He had commanded the skies above
    and opened the doors of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and He rained down manna upon them to eat
    and gave them the grain of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man ate the food of mighty angels;
    He sent them bread in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused an east wind to blow in the heavens,
    and by His power He brought out a south wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rained meat on them as dust,
    and winged birds as the sand of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and He let them fall in the midst of their camp
    all around their habitations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they ate and were satisfied,
    for He gave them their own desire;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
while they were not yet filled up,
    and while the meat was still in their mouths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the wrath of God came upon them,
    and He killed the strongest of them
    and struck down the young men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all this they sinned still,
    and did not believe despite His wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore He made their days vanish like a breath,
    and their years in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He killed them, then they sought Him;
    they turned back and longed for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They remembered that God was their rock,
    and the Most High God their redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouth,
    and they lied to Him with their tongues;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their heart was not devoted to Him,
    neither were they committed to His covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He being full of compassion
    forgave their iniquity
    and did not destroy them.
He constantly restrained His anger,
    and did not stir up all His wrath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for He remembered that they were but flesh,
    like a wind that passes away and does not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How often they provoked Him in the wilderness
    and grieved Him in the desert!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, they tested God over and over,
    and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not remember His power,
    nor the day when He delivered them from the enemy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
how He had performed His signs in Egypt
    and His wonders in the fields of Zoan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and He turned their rivers into blood,
    so that they could not drink from their streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them,
    and frogs, which destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave also their crops to the grasshopper
    and the fruit of their labor to the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their vines with hail
    and their sycamore trees with frost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave up their cattle also to the hail
    and their flocks to thunderbolts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cast upon them the fierceness of His anger,
    wrath, indignation, and trouble,
    by sending angels bringing disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
    the first fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He led out His own people like sheep
    and guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He led them in safety, so that they were not afraid,
    but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought them to the border of His holy land,
    to the mountain that His right hand had acquired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cast out the nations also before them,
    and divided for them their tribal allotments,
    and made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they tested and provoked the Most High God,
    and did not keep His commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers;
    they turned aside like a deceitful bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they provoked Him to anger with their high places
    and moved Him to jealousy with their graven images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When God heard this, He was full of wrath
    and greatly rejected Israel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that He left the tabernacle at Shiloh,
    the tent where He lived among people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and delivered His strength to captivity
    and His glory into the enemy’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave His people over also to the sword;
    He was enraged with His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fire consumed their young men,
    and their maidens were not given to marriage in song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their priests fell by the sword,
    and their widows made no lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awoke as one out of sleep,
    and like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He routed His enemies back,
    and He made them a perpetual reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, He rejected the tent of Joseph,
    and He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but chose the tribe of Judah,
    Mount Zion which He loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He built His sanctuary like the high heavens,
    like the earth that He has established perpetually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose David His servant
    and took him from the sheepfolds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from following the nursing ewes He brought him
    to shepherd Jacob His people,
    and Israel His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart
    and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The dead bodies of Your servants
    they have given to the birds of the sky for food
    and the flesh of Your faithful to the animals of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their blood they have poured out like water
    all around Jerusalem,
    and there was no one to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become a reproach to our neighbors,
    a scorn and derision to those who are around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will You be angry forever?
    Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out Your wrath
    upon the nations who do not know You,
and upon the kingdoms
    who have not called upon Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have devoured Jacob,
    and laid waste his dwelling place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help us, O God of our salvation,
    for the glory of Your name;
deliver us, and purge away our sins,
    for Your name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?” 
May the avenging of the shed blood of Your servants
    be known among the nations before our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their lap
    the reproach that they have reproached You, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But we are Your people, the sheep of Your pasture,
    and will give You thanks forever;
we will declare Your praise
    to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the sight of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh,
stir up Your strength,
    and come and rescue us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us again, O God,
    and cause Your face to shine,
    and we shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of Hosts,
    how long will You be angry
    against the prayers of Your people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have fed them with the bread of tears
    and have given them tears to drink in great measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make us contention for our neighbors,
    and our enemies laugh among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us again, O God of Hosts,
    and cause Your face to shine,
    and we shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
    You have cast out the nations and planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cleared the ground for it;
    it took deep root and filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains were covered with its shadow
    and the mighty cedars with its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It sent out its branches to the sea
    and its shoots to the River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have You then broken down its walls,
    so that all those who pass by the way pluck its fruit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boar from the woods ravages it,
    and the insects of the field devour it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and the root that Your right hand has planted,
    and the shoots that You made strong for Yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is burned with fire; it is cut down;
    may they perish at the rebuke from Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand,
    the son of man whom You made strong for Yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So we will not turn back from You;
    give us life, and we will call upon Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing aloud unto God our strength;
    make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up a melody, and sound the tambourine,
    the pleasant lyre with the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the trumpet at the New Moon,
    at the full moon on our feast day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is a statute for Israel,
    a decree of the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This He ordained in Joseph as a decree
    when He went out against the land of Egypt. 
I heard a voice that I had not known:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I removed his shoulder from the burden;
    his hands were released from holding the basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O My people, and I will testify against you.
    O Israel, if you would listen to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall be no strange god among you;
    neither shall you bow down to any strange god.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“But My people would not listen to My voice;
    Israel would not submit to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I gave them up to their stubborn hearts,
    to walk in their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh, that My people would listen to Me,
    and Israel would follow in My ways!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would soon subdue their enemies,
    and turn My hand against their adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who hate the Lord cower before Him
    and their fate might last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I would feed them with the finest of wheat,
    and with honey out of the rock I would satisfy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God stands among the divine council;
    He renders judgment among the gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you all judge unjustly
    and accept partiality of the wicked? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Defend the poor and fatherless;
    vindicate the afflicted and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grant escape to the abused and the destitute,
    pluck them out of the hand of the false.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have said, “You are gods,
    sons of the Most High, all of you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but you all shall die like men,
    and fall like a man, O princes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O God, judge the earth,
    for You shall inherit all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not keep Your silence, O God;
    do not hold Your peace or be still, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, look, Your enemies make an uproar,
    and those who hate You have lifted up their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have given crafty counsel against Your people,
    and have consulted against Your treasured ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have said, “Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation,
    that the name of Israel may be no more remembered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have conspired together;
    they make a covenant against You—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
    even Moab and the Hagrites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
    the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assyria also is joined with them,
    they are the strength of the descendants of Lot. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do to them as You did to the Midianites,
    as to Sisera and Jabin at the river of Kishon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who perished at Endor;
    they became as dung for the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb;
    yes, all their princes as Zebah and Zalmunna,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said, “Let us take for ourselves
    the pastures of God as a possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my God, make them like a tumbleweed,
    as stubble before the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As fire burns a forest,
    and as the flame sets the mountains ablaze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so pursue them with Your storm,
    and make them afraid with Your hurricane.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fill their faces with shame,
    that they may seek your name, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be confounded and troubled forever;
    yes, let them be put to shame and perish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they may know that You, whose name alone is the Lord,
    are the Most High over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How lovely is Your dwelling place,
    O Lord of Hosts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul longs, yes, even faints
    for the courts of the Lord;
my heart and my body cry out
    for the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the sparrow has found a home
    and the swallow a nest for herself,
    where she may lay her young,
even at Your altars,
    O Lord of Hosts, my King and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who dwell in Your house;
    they continually praise You. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in You,
    in whose heart are the paths to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They go from strength to strength;
    every one of them appears in Zion before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of Hosts, hear my prayer,
    and give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, O God our shield,
    and look upon the face of Your anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a day in Your courts is better
    than a thousand elsewhere.
I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God
    than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord God is a sun and shield;
    the Lord will give favor and glory,
for no good thing will He withhold
    from the one who walks uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord of Hosts,
    blessed is the man who trusts in You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, You have been favorable to Your land;
    You have brought back the captivity of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people;
    You have covered all their sin. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have withdrawn all Your wrath;
    You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us, O God of our salvation,
    and put away Your indignation toward us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will You be angry with us forever?
    Will You draw out Your anger to all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will You not revive us again,
    that Your people may rejoice in You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show us Your mercy, O Lord,
    and grant us Your deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely His salvation is near to them who fear Him,
    that glory may dwell in our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mercy and truth have met together;
    righteousness and peace have kissed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truth springs from the ground,
    and righteousness looks down from the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the Lord gives that which is good,
    and our land shall yield its increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness shall go before Him
    and prepare a way for His footsteps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline Your ear, O Lord, and answer me,
    for I am oppressed and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O Lord,
    for to You I cry all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For You, Lord, are good, and forgiving,
    abounding in kindness to all who call on You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer,
    and attend to my plea for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day of my trouble I will call upon You,
    for You will answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the gods there is none like You, O Lord;
    neither are there any works like Your works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations whom You have made
    shall come and worship before You, O Lord,
    and shall glorify Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You are great and do wondrous deeds;
    You are God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me Your way, O Lord,
    that I will walk in Your truth;
bind my heart
    to fear Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give You thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
    and I will glorify Your name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is Your mercy toward me,
    and You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O Lord, are a God full of compassion and gracious,
    slow to anger, and abundant in mercy and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Show me a sign of Your favor,
    that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed
    because You, Lord, have helped and comforted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city of His foundation is on the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord loves the gates of Zion
    more than all the dwelling places of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
    O city of God. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But of Zion it shall be said,
    “This one and that one were born in her,”
    for the Most High shall make her secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord shall count when He registers the people,
    “This one was born there.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As well the singers and the players of instruments say,
    “All my springs are in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, God of my salvation,
    I cry out day and night before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my prayer come before You;
    incline Your ear to my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my soul is full of troubles,
    and my life draws near to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am counted with those who go down to the grave;
    I am a man who has no strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
like one who is set free among the dead,
    like the slain who lie in the grave,
like those whom You remember no more,
    for they are cut off from Your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have laid me in the depths of the pit,
    in dark and deep regions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath lies heavy upon me,
    and You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
my eye is dim from my affliction. 
Lord, I call daily upon You,
    and I have stretched out my hands to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will You show wonders to the dead?
    Shall the dead rise up to praise You? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave,
    or your faithfulness in Abaddon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall Your wonders be known in the darkness
    or Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But unto You have I cried, O Lord,
    and in the morning my prayer comes before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, why do You cast away my soul?
    Why do You hide Your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am afflicted and close to death since my youth;
    while I suffer Your terrors I am helpless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your fierce wrath sweeps over me;
    Your terrors destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They come around me daily like a flood;
    they encircle me together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have caused to be far from me my lovers and friends,
    and my companion is darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of the mercies of the Lord forever;
    with my mouth I will make known Your faithfulness to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up forever;
    Your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
    I have sworn to David my servant:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Your offspring I will establish forever,
    and build up your throne for all generations.’ ” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens praise Your wonders, O Lord;
    Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who in the skies can be compared to the Lord?
    Who among the heavenly sons is like the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the holy ones
    and awesome to all those who surround Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of Hosts, who is a mighty Lord like You,
    with Your faithfulness all around You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rule the raging of the sea;
    when the waves arise, You still them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed Rahab like a corpse;
    You scattered Your enemies with Your strong arm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are Yours; the earth also is Yours;
    the world and all that is in it, You have founded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north and the south, You have created them;
    Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have a mighty arm,
    and strong is Your hand, and victorious is Your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne;
    mercy and truth shall go before Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout.
    They walk, O Lord, in the light of Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Your name they rejoice all the day,
    and in Your righteousness they shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You are the beauty of their strength;
    by Your favor our horn is exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is our shield of defense,
    and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago You spoke in a vision
    to Your godly one and said:
“I have given help to one who is mighty;
    I have exalted one chosen from the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have found David, My servant;
    with My holy oil I have anointed him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By whom My hand shall be established;
    My arm also shall strengthen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy shall not take tribute from him,
    nor the wicked humiliate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will beat down his foes before him
    and strike down those who hate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him,
    and in My name his horn shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set his hand on the sea
    and his right hand on the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall cry unto Me, ‘You are my Father, my God,
    and the Rock of my salvation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also I will make him my firstborn,
    the highest of the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In My mercy I will keep him forever,
    and My covenant shall stand firm with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His offspring also I will establish forever
    and his throne as the days of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If his children forsake My law
    and do not walk in My judgments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if they break My statutes
    and do not keep My commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
